pageContext.claim: “Very proud of my Executive Order which will allow greatly expanded access and far lower costs for HealthCare. Millions of people benefit!”
pageContext.analysis: On Oct. 12 Trump signed an executive order eliminating cost-sharing reduction payments to insurance companies. He claims the order will result in lower costs, but according to a report from the Congressional Budget Office, premiums for 2018 would increase by 20% over the CBO's current baseline and by 25% over the 2020 projection. Additionally, about 1 million people would lose coverage in 2018.
